page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO S.HARRIS
page.content: { WELCOME TO SOUTH HARRIS The {ISLAND OF HARRIS}is the southern part of what is sometimes called the { {LONG ISLAND}i.e.{LEWIS}and {HARRIS.}It is situated off the North West coast of Scotland in the chain of islands called the {OUTER HEBRIDES.}Our survey concerns {S.HARRIS}i.e an area from {FINSBAY}on the east side to{RODEL}, {STROND , LEVERBURGH}&{NORTHTON }in the south. The east side has a very rocky coastline & landscape while the west side has wide expanses of sandy beaches.{LEVERBURGH},originally named {OBBE}(Gaelic for inlet) was renamed after{LORD LEVERHULME},an Englishman who purchased HARRIS in 1919 and spent a considerable amount of money to develop the fishing industry by building a large pier, kippering houses,fishermen's houses and lighthouses.
